THE SUPREME COURT OF APPEAL
OF SOUTH AFRICA
Case No 261/94, 59/96, 245/94, 230/94, and 320/94.
In the matter between:
PHILLIP MALEFANE
First Appellant
(Accused 1 in Court a quo)

sections.facts: The factual background of the case is not provided in the excerpt; the appeal concerns criminal charges against Malefane and others.
sections.issues: The legal issues involve the correctness of the conviction and/or sentence imposed on the appellants and whether any error was made in the trial court proceedings.
sections.principles: The Court would apply principles of criminal law, the standard of proof beyond reasonable doubt, and rules of procedural fairness governing appeals from criminal convictions.
sections.application: Applying those principles, the Court would examine the trial record to determine if any misdirection, error of law, or procedural irregularity affected the verdict or sentence.
sections.conclusion: The judgment was delivered on 1 June 1998 by the Supreme Court of Appeal; the excerpt does not disclose the specific outcome, but the Court rendered its decision on the appeal at that date.
